body: Found here: https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/actions/runs/1863916365 Depends on: https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/2058 --- This change isâ€‚[](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/2064)

comment_data.body: Are all these casts safe? Do we need asserts to make sure they are?
Let's try to avoid adding more `goto` and instead use an inner function with a cleanup outside.
I just took this from the existing code, but added asserts anyway.
Changed the structure, though no inner function.
Finally understand how you meant that and did it.
nit: remove empty line between comment and thing-to-be-commented.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3392,105 +3392,153 @@ uint8_t *conferences_save(const Group_Chats *g_c, uint8_t *data)
     return data;
 }
 
+/**
+ * @brief load_group Load a Group section from a save file
+ * @param g Group to load
+ * @param g_c Reference to all groupchats, need for utility functions
+ * @param data Start of the data to deserialze
+ * @param length Length of data
+ * @return 0 on error, number of consumed bytes otherwise
+ */
+

commit.message:
fix: memory leak during conference load

This was found in our continous fuzzing setup.
